alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coweta; Heard (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Carroll, northern Heard and western Coweta Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1244 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Ranburne to near Clem to Newnan, and moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Newnan, Carrollton, Bowdon, Mount Zion, Whitesburg, Ephesus, Centralhatchee, Moreland, Roopville, East Newnan, Plant Yates, Seaton Lake, Dunaway Gardens, Clem, John Tanner State Park, Blackjack Mountain, Madras, Byers Crossroads, Arnco-Sargent and Tyus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
